turns.speaker: MAID
turns.text: Oh Lord! I'd do just about anything for that!

turns.speaker: GONZO
turns.text: You and a lot of other people.

turns.speaker: GONZO
turns.text: Oh, and don't bother to make up the room. That way we won't have to risk another of these little incidents, will we?

turns.speaker: MAID
turns.text: Whatever you say, gentlemen. I can't tell you how sorry I am about what happened...

turns.speaker: GONZO
turns.text: Don't worry, it's all over now. Thank God for the decent people.

turns.speaker: TRAMPY
turns.text: It serves you right. You cheatin' jerk.

turns.speaker: TRAMPY
turns.text: I figure it's karma. You wronged me and you wronged your wife and you wronged your children, so this is karma biting you on the ass, or in your case...  ...on the eye.

turns.speaker: TRAMPY
turns.text: What the fuck are you doing he's in there!

turns.speaker: ADULTERER
turns.text: They can't get in here!  You said it yourself, they'll get in!

turns.speaker: ADULTERER
turns.text: They'll get in! We'll all die!

turns.speaker: ADULTERER
turns.text: You can't keep me here. This is bullshit. Fuckin' bullshit. This is fucking BULLSHIT!

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: We can't risk letting them in.

turns.speaker: ADULTERER
turns.text: I'm telling you, I don't see a thing --

turns.speaker: ADULTERER
turns.text: I will not die because of him!

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Don't be stupid, drop the gun!

turns.speaker: ADULTERER
turns.text: We should go! We should go right now!

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: He's right, let's move. Be quiet and get to the exit. Pair up, grab the weapons.

turns.speaker: ADULTERER
turns.text: Are you two all right? Did you see that!? They left! We made it! I think we made it!

turns.speaker: ADULTERER
turns.text: Oh, come on! Can't you be happy for one split second? They're gone!

turns.speaker: ADULTERER
turns.text: I don't wanna go home alone... I don't wanna see what might have...

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: We're going to get my little girl.

turns.speaker: ADULTERER
turns.text: Sorry, didn't mean to scare you.

turns.speaker: ADULTERER
turns.text: I don't know, I just got here. Did you find your girl?

turns.speaker: BOSS MAN
turns.text: IS THERE A GUN POINTING AT YOU?

turns.speaker: BOSS MAN
turns.text: My god damn foot is gone! Who fuckin' shot me? Who fuckin' shot me!?

turns.speaker: BOSS MAN
turns.text: I got my .38 here. That's six shots and two refills. Downstairs, I think we got another rifle, maybe a scatterer and some gardening tools. Maybe a couple boxes of shells for The Judge.

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: I got shells too, box and a half, tops.

turns.speaker: BEER GUY
turns.text: One keg of Beast for the basement, then, truck's dry.

turns.speaker: BEER GUY
turns.text: I have a CB in my truck, we could get some help out here.

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: Who the hell would you call?

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: Hey. You noticed that no one's been killed or maimed for awhile?

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: Hey! Get quiet or get out.

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: I think I know where a CB is.

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: Okay, now. Easy steps. Easy breaths. Easy steps.

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: If we move in a group, we are one target. If we scatter, they CAN'T get us all.

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: Well, your last words can be "I told you so."

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: You gotta be with me on this.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: That's the oldest of the bunch, looked like the Grandpapa. We caught the little one, Junior, in the cooler there. As we've seen, what he lacks in size he more than makes up for in speed.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Unfortunately, the worst of 'em are still outside.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: And that's how I ended up here.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: No, no, no it was... it was wild out there, no time to think, we just moved. He didn't leave me. He just ran.  He just ran.

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: Jesus Christ, I'm gonna have a stroke.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Don't bullshit me! If you know a way out of this place and you're holding out --

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: It's in the basement, about a hundred yards long. It spits out on the backside of that hill down the way. There's a truck there.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: HEY! No, I'm not trusting him either, that's why you and I will both be going with him.

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: What!? I'm not going down there again!

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: This is it! This is our only way out! They have this place surrounded. We go out the front, we're dead. We go out the back, we're dead, but if we go UNDER them... we might just make it.  Now, who else is in? Seven can go.

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: This is a bottleneck waiting to happen.

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: In the corner, behind the curtain.

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: I'm gonna shoot him if they don't get him first.

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: You seem mighty collected about this.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Buddy, I'm a full-blooded Chucktow. I can't think of a time my people haven't been takin' it dry. The fact that we are being eaten now, doesn't even faze me...  ...this is just another Tuesday.

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: You're trusting that guy? He'll ditch us and never look back.

turns.speaker: ROADIE
turns.text: Of course not. I fight monsters all the time.

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: I'd love to be macho, but this is a pants wetter from all angles.

turns.speaker: ROADIE
turns.text: That's an unwise thing to say, you know that?

turns.speaker: ROADIE
turns.text: Well, why don't you keep your observations to yourself?

turns.speaker: BEER GUY
turns.text: So, what now? Did those things leave?

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: Why don't you go check it out?

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: I'm telling ya, you got the cloth too deep, you're asking for it.

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: Do you drive a short beer bus or something? You go out there you get eaten, you stay in here you get eaten, anyone comes to help they get eaten. Don't you see a pattern here, Spuds Makenzie?

turns.speaker: BEER GUY
turns.text: Well then I guess we should just give up.

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: Believe me, I'd love to save the day and get some heroic snatch. But it's not in the cards, partner.

turns.speaker: BEER GUY
turns.text: Why do you take shit from him?

turns.speaker: PARA
turns.text: Look, yeah, he's an ass, but he's my brother. Que sera-sera.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: All right!  Tell us about the truck!

turns.speaker: BEER GUY
turns.text: Uh, uh, I think if we can get everyone into it... we can get out of here.

turns.speaker: BEER GUY
turns.text: My truck can't be more than ten feet away. We load into the back, I can get in the front and we roll out of here.

turns.speaker: BEER GUY
turns.text: Nothing, this was my last delivery.

turns.speaker: BEER GUY
turns.text: Yeah, the lot's right there. My truck is right out back.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: But not flush against the tunnel?

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: It's imperative that you get that truck moving.

turns.speaker: BEER GUY
turns.text: Just cover me. It was built to move.

turns.speaker: BOSS MAN
turns.text: Push and twist, it's child proof.

turns.speaker: BOSS MAN
turns.text: Gimme a couple dabs on the tongue.

turns.speaker: BOSS MAN
turns.text: Magic potion.  You should try a little.

turns.speaker: BOSS MAN
turns.text: It'll calm your nerves. Works like a charm.

turns.speaker: BOSS MAN
turns.text: Uh huh. Just put a dab on your tongue.

turns.speaker: BELLE
turns.text: Will I go crazy or something?

turns.speaker: BOSS MAN
turns.text: No, no, it calms you, makes everything nice and smooth. Just takes the edge off like a beer, but in a fraction of the time.

turns.speaker: BOSS MAN
turns.text: Wait, before you do that, help me to the kitchen, I need to lay down. There's a cot back there.

turns.speaker: BOSS MAN
turns.text: It's much safer in there, sweety.

turns.speaker: BOSS MAN
turns.text: I can't feel a thing, Hon.

turns.speaker: BELLE
turns.text: How much you got to see the show?

turns.speaker: BOSS MAN
turns.text: You don't understand sweety, Daddy doesn't pay, Daddy sees the show for free. But you do get points for being horny on a night like this.

turns.speaker: BOSS MAN
turns.text: Uh huh, now wiggle that sweet little ass over here and sit on Daddy's face, I wanna do some appraising.

turns.speaker: BOSS MAN
turns.text: Jesus Christ on the cross... Someone make sense.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Easy. We're surrounded by something the likes none of you have ever seen before. Some kind of animals. Real fast, volatile, predators. ONE went through three of your patrons like they were Kleenex.

turns.speaker: BOSS MAN
turns.text: So, your dead hubby shot me twice, three of my customers have been eaten, and there are angry creatures outside?

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: He shot you the other time.

turns.speaker: BOSS MAN
turns.text: The boards are solid oak planks, and the floor is reinforced by a steel grid beneath. Nothing real or supernatural is busting through this, least nothing the size of the beasts.

turns.speaker: BOSS MAN
turns.text: In the kitchen, under the sink.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: No one goes anywhere alone. Least of all, unarmed.

turns.speaker: BOSS MAN
turns.text: Go for it. It's by the far wall. A small wave band. Channel 9 is the emergency frequency. But I don't see the point.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: You're wasting your time, there's no one out there.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: What's going on between you two?

turns.speaker: BOSS MAN
turns.text: Grass. I grow some pot down there. It's no big deal, just something I dabble in. The truck's for a quick get away, deliveries, whatever.

turns.speaker: BOSS MAN
turns.text: What!? So you can just get the hell outta here and forget about all of us!? No way! That's my god damn truck!

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Let me make this clear; if we stay, we die!

turns.speaker: BOSS MAN
turns.text: I don't trust you. No way! I pick who goes! And I'm holding you responsible.

turns.speaker: GRANDPA
turns.text: This one will just stun ya, but this one will put ya to sleep.

turns.speaker: GRANDPA
turns.text: You young'uns worry about weapons, I'm thinkin' bout strategy.

turns.speaker: GRANDPA
turns.text: Sit still, look less like a meal.

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: I think that's for bears and sharks, chunky chew.

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: They're probably on to the next buffet by now. There's a retirement home up the road. They'd be easy.

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: What are you gonna do? Throw your teeth at 'em? Sit down, Cocoon.

turns.speaker: ROADIE
turns.text: They were all over the place.

turns.speaker: ROADIE
turns.text: Look, the armed surround the unarmed in a circle and we move as a tight group. Those that can shoot, protect the rest to his ride.

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: Hey, when this plan completely goes to shit, what are ya gonna do?

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: What the hell's going on here!?

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: NO, but I will lock you in.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: We'll be on the other side waiting for you. If you become food I don't want the only set of keys in the belly of one of those things. It's your funeral.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: You are taking a chance that is not worth the risk.

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: Well, we are one miracle short tonight. So, just guard the stairs?

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Done. But you're locked in.  Will you hold the keys?

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: JUST A BAT! I'M FINE! JUST A BAT! SORRY!

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: REPEAT. WE NEED HELP. SOS. CALLING ALL CARS! WE NEED HELP AT THE UNITED NATIONS TAV--!
